result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM  Attorney Gregory J. Jerabek in court for Benjamin D. Schultz.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court.   22CF110 Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1. 22CF86 - Counts 2 & 3 defendant enters a plea of Guilty. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm contrary to 948.03(2)(b), 2 Counts Bail Jumping-Felony contrary to 946.49(1)(b). Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 
22CF86 - Ct 1 DRI, remaining Counts DRI in 22CF54, 22CF62, 22CF66 and uncharged read ins.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

3:29PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Benjamin D. Schultz. State is in victim rights compliance. State calls 1st witness, Officer JD: sworn, states occupation of a Deputy Sheriff. On duty on night of incident, testifies to incident, conversations with H. Argument occurred at 12:30 am. Testified to victim's descriptions of what happened between defendant and victims. Victim called 911. Testified to conversation with G. Spoke w/both parties on that evening. Record reflects identification of defendant. Cross examination. In respect to case 22CF54, State rests. State makes argument. Defense makes argument, asks court to dismiss Count 3. Court finds probable cause. 

 Competency hearing and arraignment 8/29 @ 1:30 PM.

1:23 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant moves to dismiss 54, 62,66, 86. Court denies motion. Court has denied request to waive right to counsel again today. Bond Review Hearing set for 7/113 @ 1 pm.

3:19 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. JA continuing to look for Atty.
